poem.title: Not by Bread Alone
poem.author: Peter McCarey
poem.text: On the river bed On the river bend On shingle such as caddis worms compile Where frail signals bred Though some of them don't so much breed as Blend and subdivide What bled in the rush, in the rushes Belled and shunned for its native sly Would have begged, the fallen, would have begged.
